events.originalText: 28 tornadoes (one depicted) touched down in midwestern and southern United States, part of an outbreak that led to the deaths of nine people and large property damage.
events.subtitle: 2010 New Year's Eve tornado outbreak
events.headline: 28 tornadoes hit midwestern and southern United States, 9 dead

events.originalText: War in Somalia: Transitional Federal Government forces attacked the last stronghold of the Islamic Courts Union in the town of Jilib.
events.subtitle: War in Somalia (2006–2009)
events.headline: Transitional Federal Government forces attack Islamic Courts Union stronghold in Jilib

events.originalText: Russian prime minister Vladimir Putin became acting president upon President Boris Yeltsin's unexpected resignation.
events.subtitle: Vladimir Putin
events.headline: Vladimir Putin becomes acting president after Boris Yeltsin's resignation

events.originalText: The European Exchange Rate Mechanism froze the exchange rates of the legacy currencies in the eurozone, establishing the value of the euro.
events.subtitle: European Exchange Rate Mechanism
events.headline: European Exchange Rate Mechanism freezes legacy currencies in eurozone

events.originalText: Brandon Teena, an American trans man, was raped and murdered in Humboldt, Nebraska; his death led to increased lobbying for hate crime laws in the United States.
events.subtitle: Brandon Teena
events.headline: American trans man Brandon Teena raped and murdered in Humboldt, Nebraska

events.originalText: Three disgruntled employees set fire to the Dupont Plaza Hotel in San Juan, Puerto Rico, killing more than 90 people and injuring 140 others, making it the second-deadliest hotel fire in United States history.
events.subtitle: Dupont Plaza Hotel arson
events.headline: Disgruntled employees set fire to Dupont Plaza Hotel in San Juan, Puerto Rico, 90 dead

events.originalText: Puerto Rican baseball player Roberto Clemente died in a plane crash en route to deliver aid to victims of that year's Nicaragua earthquake.
events.subtitle: Roberto Clemente
events.headline: Puerto Rican baseball player Roberto Clemente dies in plane crash

events.originalText: Central African military officers led by Jean-Bédel Bokassa began a coup d'état against the government of President David Dacko.
events.subtitle: Jean-Bédel Bokassa
events.headline: Central African military officers led by Jean-Bédel Bokassa stage coup d'état

events.originalText: RTÉ, Ireland's first television network, began broadcasting.
events.subtitle: RTÉ
events.headline: Ireland's first television network RTÉ begins broadcasting

events.originalText: Korean War: North Korean troops attacked United Nations forces in the first of two battles at Wonju.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: Korean War: North Korean troops attack UN forces at Wonju

events.originalText: The Manhattan Bridge, connecting Lower Manhattan to Downtown Brooklyn and considered to be the forerunner of modern suspension bridges, opened to traffic.
events.subtitle: Manhattan Bridge
events.headline: Manhattan Bridge opens, connecting Lower Manhattan to Downtown Brooklyn

events.originalText: New York City held its first annual ball drop event in Times Square as part of New Year's Eve celebrations.
events.subtitle: Times Square Ball
events.headline: New York City holds first annual ball drop event in Times Square

events.originalText: The Battle of Stones River in Murfreesboro, Tennessee, began with an engagement in which both sides would suffer their highest casualty rates in the American Civil War.
events.subtitle: Battle of Stones River
events.headline: Battle of Stones River begins in Murfreesboro, Tennessee, high casualty rates

events.originalText: Queen Victoria announced the choice of Ottawa (pictured), then a small logging town, to be the capital of the British colony of Canada.
events.subtitle: Queen Victoria
events.headline: Queen Victoria chooses Ottawa as capital of British colony of Canada

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: At the Battle of Quebec, British forces repulsed an attack by the Continental Army to capture Quebec City and enlist French Canadian support.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British forces repulse Continental Army attack at Battle of Quebec

events.originalText: Arthur Guinness signed a 9,000-year lease at £45 per annum to the St. James's Gate Brewery in Dublin and began brewing Guinness.
events.subtitle: Arthur Guinness
events.headline: Arthur Guinness signs lease to St. James's Gate Brewery, begins brewing Guinness
